channel.title: Discoveries of an AdventureR
channel.description: Recent content on Discoveries of an AdventureR

item.title: Submission for r/dataisbeautiful Dataviz Battle of February
item.description: This post reports the development process I carried for the DataViz battle of February 2018. The rules can be found in the link. Raw Data This month, the data source is a on a github repo. It contains all same-sex marriage legal status for each states of the USA from 1995 to 2015. Import Data (from github) Found how to do it at Github/Opetchey library(RCurl) library(tidyverse) raw_data <- as_data_frame(read.

item.title: First article and Submission for r/dataisbeautiful DataViz Battle of January
item.description: As first article on this R, datascience and dataviz dedicated blog, I present to you my entry for the DataViz battle of January 2018. The rules can be found in the link. Data This month, the data source is a .htm webpage containing several algae growthrates for several light and temperature conditions. How I worked on this For this project I used : R for Data importation Data wrangling and cleaning Model analysis Tableau Data exploration Generate the data dashboard So let’s start with R !

item.title: How I built this blog using R, Blogdown and Hugo
item.description: Material Used : *https://tclavelle.github.io/blog/blogdown_github/ *https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/github-pages.html *https://talesofr.wordpress.com/2017/08/18/starting-a-rmarkdown-blog-with-bookdown-hugo-github/ *https://yihui.name/en/2017/08/hugo-post-summary/#fnref:I-broke-the-4th How to create 2 repo username/source username/username.github.io clone repo on computer and remove readme files start new R project project option -> website, select source as base directory load necessary libraries # Load blogdown package and install Hugo library(blogdown) install_hugo() choose a theme set “source” as working directory create site # Create new site in our recently cloned blogdown repository new_site(theme = "kakawait/hugo-tranquilpeak-theme", format = 'toml') add folowing lines in config.
